abstractText: The purpose of survival monitoring is to assess the survival of containerized woody shrubs and trees and/or transplanted shrubs and trees installed as part of floodplain revegetation treatments. Floodplain revegetation treatments such as planting container-grown trees and shrubs seeks to establish native woody cover on restored floodplain surfaces as a means of providing bank stability, natural woody debris recruitment sources, and native cover type distribution throughout the project area.Data collection methods are described in Vegetation Survival Monitoring Method #1308 [https://www.monitoringresources.org/Document/Method/Details/1308]
title: Vegetation Survival Monitoring Data Analysis v1.0
